key.name: toolkit-accessibility
key.description: Whether toolkits should load accessibility related modules.

key.name: enable-animations
key.description: Whether animations should be displayed. Note: This is a global key, it changes the behaviour of the window manager, the panel etc.

key.name: menus-have-tearoff
key.description: Whether menus should have a tearoff.

key.name: can-change-accels
key.description: Whether the user can dynamically type a new accelerator when positioned over an active menuitem.

key.name: toolbar-style
key.description: Toolbar Style. Valid values are “both”, “both-horiz”, “icons”, and “text”.

key.name: menubar-detachable
key.description: Whether the user can detach menubars and move them around.

key.name: toolbar-detachable
key.description: Whether the user can detach toolbars and move them around.

key.name: toolbar-icons-size
key.description: Size of icons in toolbars, either “small” or “large”.

key.name: cursor-blink
key.description: Whether the cursor should blink.

key.name: cursor-blink-time
key.description: Length of the cursor blink cycle, in milliseconds.

key.name: cursor-blink-timeout
key.description: Time after which the cursor stops blinking, in seconds.

key.name: icon-theme
key.description: Icon theme to use for the panel, nautilus etc.

key.name: gtk-theme
key.description: Basename of the default theme used by gtk+.

key.name: gtk-key-theme
key.description: Basename of the default keybinding theme used by gtk+.

key.name: font-name
key.description: Name of the default font used by gtk+.

key.name: avatar-directories
key.description: Directories to override the default avatar faces installed by gnome-control-center.

key.name: text-scaling-factor
key.description: Factor used to enlarge or reduce text display, without changing font size.

key.name: scaling-factor
key.description: Integer factor used to scale windows by. For use on high-dpi screens. 0 means pick automatically based on monitor.

key.name: gtk-im-preedit-style
key.description: Name of the GTK+ input method Preedit Style used by gtk+.

key.name: gtk-im-status-style
key.description: Name of the GTK+ input method Status Style used by gtk+.

key.name: gtk-im-module
key.description: Name of the input method module used by GTK+.

key.name: document-font-name
key.description: Name of the default font used for reading documents.

key.name: monospace-font-name
key.description: Name of a monospaced (fixed-width) font for use in locations like terminals.

key.name: menubar-accel
key.description: Keyboard shortcut to open the menu bars.

key.name: cursor-theme
key.description: Cursor theme name. Used only by Xservers that support the Xcursor extension.

key.name: cursor-size
key.description: Size of the cursor used as cursor theme.

key.name: gtk-timeout-initial
key.description: Timeout in milliseconds before a click starts repeating (on spinner buttons for example).

key.name: gtk-timeout-repeat
key.description: Timeout in milliseconds between repeated clicks when a button is left pressed.

key.name: gtk-color-palette
key.summary: Palette used in the color selector
key.description: Palette used in the color selector as defined by the “gtk-color-palette” setting

key.name: gtk-color-scheme
key.summary: List of symbolic names and color equivalents
key.description: A “\n” separated list of “name:color” as defined by the “gtk-color-scheme” setting

key.name: clock-format
key.summary: Whether the clock displays in 24h or 12h format
key.description: Whether the clock displays in 24h or 12h format

key.name: clock-show-seconds
key.description: If true, display seconds in the clock.

key.name: clock-show-date
key.description: If true, display date in the clock, in addition to time.

key.name: clock-show-weekday
key.description: If true, display weekday in the clock, in addition to time.

key.name: enable-hot-corners
key.description: If true, the activities overview can be accessed by moving the mouse to the top-left corner.

key.name: show-battery-percentage
key.description: If true, display battery percentage in the status menu, in addition to the icon.

key.name: gtk-enable-primary-paste
key.description: If true, gtk+ uses the primary paste selection, usually triggered by a middle mouse button click.

key.name: overlay-scrolling
key.description: Whether scrollbars should be overlayed as indicators. Depending on input devices in use, permanent scrollbars may still be displayed.

key.name: locate-pointer
key.summary: Highlights the current location of the pointer.
key.description: If true, pressing a key will highlight the current pointer location on screen.

key.name: font-antialiasing
key.description: The type of antialiasing to use when rendering fonts. Possible values are: “none” for no antialiasing, “grayscale” for standard grayscale antialiasing, and “rgba” for subpixel antialiasing (LCD screens only).

key.name: font-hinting
key.description: The type of hinting to use when rendering fonts. Possible values are: “none” for no hinting and “slight” for fitting only to the Y-axis like Microsoft’s ClearType, DirectWrite and Adobe’s proprietary font rendering engine. Ignores native hinting within the font, generates hints algorithmically. Used on Ubuntu by default. Recommended. The meaning of “medium” and “full” depends on the font format (.ttf, .otf, .pfa/.pfb) and the installed version of FreeType. They usually try to fit glyphs to both the X and the Y axis (except for .otf: Y-only). This can lead to distortion and/or inconsistent rendering depending on the quality of the font, the font format and the state of FreeType’s font engines.

key.name: font-rgba-order
key.description: The order of subpixel elements on an LCD screen; only used when antialiasing is set to “rgba”. Possible values are: “rgb” for red on left (most common), “bgr” for blue on left, “vrgb” for red on top, “vbgr” for red on bottom.
